text: Number systems, rational/real numbers and sets Student exercises 1 NB! This is not an assignment for submission. This is to test your knowledge. Unit 1,2 and 3 (without solutions) Number systems, rational/real and sets 1. Which of these numbers below are prime numbers 29 3 9 2 11 15 22 a) 29, 3, 9 and 11 b) 2, 3 and 22 c) 2, 29, 11 and 3 d) 15, 2, 3 and 22 2. What is the value of 0! a) 1 b) 0 c) -1 d) not possible 3. The set of all non-negative integers less than 9 can be represented by a) {x | x ∈ Z ≥, 0 ≤ x ≤ 9} b) {1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8} c) {x | x ∈ Z ≥, 0 ≤ x < 9} d) {x | x ∈ Z +, 0 < x < 9} 4. Questions 4 to 9 relate to the following sets. Suppose U = {2, π, 3, √ 5, {8}, 8} is a universal set with the following subsets: A = {2, π}, B = {2, √5}, C = {√ 5, {8}, 3} Determine A ∪ C a) {2, π, 3, √5, 8} b) {2, π, 3, √5, {8}} c) {π, 3, √5, {8}, 8} d) {2, π, √ 5, {8}, 8} 5. Which one of the following sets represents B ∩ C a) {2, 3} b) {√5} c) {3,{8}} d) {2} 6. Which one of the following sets represents B’ - C a) {3} b) {3, {8}} 7 8 page - 1 COS1501-22-Y-3E/Tutor Site Unit 1,2 and 3 Number systems, rational/real numbers and sets c) {π, 8} d) {π,{8}} 7. Which one of the following sets represents (A ∩ C) ∪ B a) {2} b) {2, √ 5} c) {2, √5 , ∅} d) ∅ 8. Which of the following operations will yield a set whose elements are all irra- tional? a) A + B b) A’ - C c) (A ∪ B) ∪ C’ d) B’ + A 9. Which statement below is N OT true a) The set B + C has three elements. Two of which are prime numbers b) The cardinality of the set B’ is 4 c) {2, √5} ⊂ B d) {3, √ 5} ⊆ C 10. Suppose a set X has 5 elements. The cardinality of the power set of X |P(X)| = a) 20 b) 12 c) 5 d) 32 11. Suppose Y = {1, 2, {1}}. Determine P(Y): a) {∅, {1}, {2}, {{1}},{1,2}, {1,{1}}, {2,{1}}, {1,2,{1}}} b) {{1}, {2}, {1,2}, {1,2,{1}}} c) {∅, {1}, {2}, {1,2}} d) {∅, {1}, {2}, {1,2}, {1,2,{1}},{2,{1}}} 12. Which one of the following is a subset of P(Y) a) {1,2,{2}} b) {{{1}}} c) {1,2,{1}} d) {{2}, 1} CB Mahlangu COS1501 e-tutor 7 8 page - 2 COS1501-22-Y-3E/Tutor Site Unit 1,2 and 3
